discourse_list.title: Taken: A Docusaurus setup to replace the existing Portal

content.content: Description There are some limitations to the gitbooks implementation that we can’t get around. Community Development would like someone to create a new framework for us with docusaurus that basically looks and behaves exactly like the existing portal. Criteria  searching with algolia or equiv easily maintained css should sit in the same repo as the existing content?  or can we set up a new repo that ingests content from the primary repo?    Interested?   github.com/makerdao/community      Issue: Docusaurus setup to replace the existing Portal   	 	opened by ghettodev 	on 2019-07-19 	 	 	  There are some limitations to the gitbooks implementation that we can’t get around. Community Development would like someone to create a...   	help wanted       If you feel you, or your team, is capable of handling this task: please feel free to ask questions in this thread, reach out to [email protected], or DM me in the chat @rich.brown. Funding will be provided through the Grants Program framework.
Is there a reason to use docusaurus instead of https://www.mkdocs.org/? Localization looks to be a main positive of docusaurus over mkdocs. I can probably look to tackle this.

searching with algolia or equiv Docusaurus doesn’t support search out of the box. It’s tentatively planned for v2. How big of a concern is that? https://github.com/facebook/Docusaurus/issues/776  actually I stand corrected    docusaurus.io    Enabling Search · Docusaurus Docusaurus supports search using [Algolia DocSearch](https://community.algolia.com/docsearch/). Once your website is online, you can [submit it to DocSearch](https://community.algolia.com/docsearch/). Algolia will then send you credentials you can...
Also, the repo will need to be ingested and altered slightly, but can be largely maintained as is.  or can we set up a new repo that ingests content from the primary repo?
A team is now working on this project.
